raw_response:
Marmouma, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban dish, is visually a rich, slow-cooked vegetable confit with a **deep reddish-orange color** from tomatoes and peppers that have been caramelized and stewed together until soft and richly flavored. It resembles a thick, chunky **stew or cooked salad** rather than a smooth sauce or dry salad.

When served, Marmouma typically appears as a **thick, chunky vegetable mixture**, not soupy, with visible softened pieces of stewed tomatoes and peppers that have broken d
